alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 1:23AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Jim Hogg and central Zapata Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 123 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Las Palmas, or 7 miles northwest of Zapata, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zapata, Bustamante, Medina, Zapata High School, Zapata County Fire Department, Escobas, Zapata Middle School, Zapata County Public Library, Las Palmas and Zapata County Airport. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 754 and 766. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
